entry.title: [BHS7][DedicatedServers] - Rack B710A08
entry.content:
Dec 14, 14:16 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 14/12/2022 14:02 UTC
End Time : 14/12/2022 14:14 UTC
Root cause : Public switch reload unexpected
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 14, 14:05 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 14/12/2022 14:02 UTC
Service impact : Servers in the rack B710A08 are no longer responding. Public network seems unavailable
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.

entry.title: [ALL][Dedicated Servers] - Repricing
entry.content:
Dec 14, 12:58 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 01/12/2022 00:01 UTC
End Time : 14/12/2022 10:00 UTC
Service impact : We detected that some promotion were not applied on last server renew.
Impacted customers will be contacted separately and will get a credit within 10 days.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 9, 11:37 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Dec 9, 09:13 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 01/12/2022 00:01 UTC
Service impact : We detected that some promotion were not applied on last server renew, we are investigating and will fix it as soon as possible
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be post as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - vMac
entry.content:
Dec 15, 11:14 UTC
Update - Our technical teams are always working on a fix.
Because our teams encountered problems while deploying the patch this morning.
Between 09:08 UTC and 10:55 UTC, IPs/blocks that were moved between two dedicated servers lost their vMac because the script did not create the tasks for the reaffiliation.
The vMac will be restored as soon as possible

Dec 15, 10:24 UTC
Update - Our technical teams are always working on a fix.

Our teams will restore vMac lost over the last 3 days, as well as vMac lost for more than 3 days reported by our support teams.

Dec 14, 16:19 UTC
Identified - Our technical teams are working on a fix for new cases. This fix will be deployed tomorrow. The vMacs will then be restored after renewal of the suspended IPs

In parallel, our teams are working on a tool to restore the vMacs lost over the last 7 days.
However, this tool will not allow to recover a vMac that you will have recreated in the meantime
We thank you for your understanding

Dec 14, 11:43 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 01/12/2022 00:00 UTC
Service impact : Customers might lose their vMac after they renew their unpaid additional IP subscription
Ongoing actions : Our teams are currently working to solve the issue

entry.title: [EU][Dedicated Servers] - IP Block operations
entry.content:
Dec 14, 08:53 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 13/12/2022 14:00
End Time : 14/12/2022 05:00
Root cause : An ongoing operation caused the delay observed
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 13, 16:44 UTC
Update - Our technical teams identified that the degradation had also affected the public network and all the operations around the IP blocks (purchase, removal etc.).

Dec 13, 16:21 UTC
Investigating - Start time: 13/12/2022 14:00
Service impact :Add/Remove of ipblock from vRack can take long times to be performed.
Ongoing Actions:Our technical teams investigate to determine the origin of the degradation

entry.title: [RBX7][DedicatedServers] - Rack R715B13
entry.content:
Dec 13, 18:31 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 13/12/2022 17:48 UTC
End Time : 13/12/2022 18:24 UTC
Root cause :Electrical disjunction
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Dec 13, 17:53 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 13/12/2022 17:48 UTC
Service impact : Servers in the rack R715B13 are no longer responding via public network
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
